alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 07 at 5:46AM PDT until May 09 at 2:34AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Washington... Okanogan River near Tonasket affecting Okanogan County. For the Okanogan River...including Tonasket...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Okanogan River near Tonasket. * WHEN...From Monday morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding of low lying areas and pasture lands is possible between Highway 7 and 97 from Oroville to Riverside. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM PDT Sunday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (5 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Okanogan River Tonasket 15.0 14.3 Sun 4 am PDT 15.0 14.8 14.2 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 715 PM PDT.
